content.question: Black rhinoceros European toad Number of offspring per reproductive event 1 600-4000 Time spent with parents after birth 2-4 years none Life span (in the wild) 30-35 years 10 years Survivorship curve Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Type <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following claims is best supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: The European toad is a <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected species because it has a Type <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> survivorship curve.
The black rhino is a <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected species because it provides no parental care.
The European toad is a <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected species because it can live up to 10 years.

The black rhino is a <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected species because it has a low number of offspring per reproductive event.

content.answer: The black rhino is a <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected species because it has a low number of offspring per reproductive event.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe patterns or trends in data.
